utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The beach house, it's the same scene from the end of last year, with Ross in front of the two doors of Rachel's and Bonnie's rooms, trying to decide which door to choose. He finally chooses the one his right and goes in.]

utterances.transcript: Hi!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (surprised) Hi!

utterances.transcript: Hi!
Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.
Awww.
Thanks a million.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Rachel) Thanks a million.

utterances.transcript: Oh, you're welcome a million.
Okay, I'll see you in our room.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (getting up and leaving) (to Ross) Okay, I'll see you in our room.

utterances.transcript: Yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. (closes the door, and goes over and kisses Rachel.)

utterances.transcript: Oh my God.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (softly) Oh my God.

utterances.transcript: I know.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both kiss again and fall onto the bed.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, I gotta go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stopping suddenly and getting up) Okay, I gotta go.

utterances.transcript: Whoa! What?! Why?!
Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie.
Here?! Now?!
Well, yeah. I can't-I can't stay here all night, and if I go in there she's-she's gonna wanna... do stuff.
Well, can't you tell her that you are not in the mood?
No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn't work either, I can't tell you how many mornings I woke up with her...
Whoa-ho.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting) Whoa-ho.

utterances.transcript: Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?
I don't know.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (they kiss again)

utterances.transcript: Yeah, yeah. It wasn't every morning.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, yeah. (opens the door) It wasn't every morning.

utterances.transcript: Oh, making it worse!
Okay.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Phoebe Sr.'s house, it's right after she told Phoebe that she's her birth mother.]

utterances.transcript: So I guess you'd like to know how it all happened.
I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y'know I was born, and everyone started lying their asses off!
Noo! No! It wasn't like that I... Remember how I told you how Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.
How close?
Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.
I don't even know how that would work!
Well, we were...
I'm not asking!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting) I'm not asking!

utterances.transcript: Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was stupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it's like to be eighteen years old?
Yeah. Let's see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off, and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.

Well, I'm so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best parents in the world, I didn't even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don't know, you're here, and I would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.

Yeah, well, everybody does! I'm a really cool person. And y'know you had 29 years to find that out, but you didn't even try! Y'know what, you walked out on me, and I'm just, I'm gonna do the same thing to you.
Wait!
I don't ever want to see you again!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She walks out and slams the door.)

utterances.transcript: Umm, where's my purse?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walking back in with her hand over her eyes.) Umm, where's my purse?

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The beach house, Rachel's bedroom. She is finishing up writing something as Ross walks through the door.]

utterances.transcript: It's over.
Oh, was it awful?
Well, it was loong. I didn't even realise how late it was, until I noticed the 5 o'clock shadow on her head. Anyway, she didn't want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, it was loong. I didn't even realise how late it was, until I noticed the 5 o'clock shadow on her head. (They both start to laugh, then stop themselves quickly.) Anyway, she didn't want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.
(They kiss.)

utterances.transcript: I wrote you a letter.
Ohh! Thank you! I like mail.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ohh! Thank you! I like mail. (He goes to kiss her again, but she turns away.)

utterances.transcript: It's just some things I've been thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (handing him the letter) It's just some things I've been thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.

utterances.transcript: Okay. Wow, it's-it's 5:30 in the morning. So, I'd better get cracking on this baby.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (He leans in to kiss her again, but she leans back preventing him from making contact.) Wow, it's-it's 5:30 in the morning. (Rachel laughs) So, I'd better get cracking on this baby.

utterances.transcript: Well, I'll be waiting for you, just come up when you're done.
Okay, I'll be up in, 18 pages. Front and back. Very exciting.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, I'll be up in, (looks at the letter) 18 pages. Front and back. Very exciting.

Rachel is hesitant to jump into another relationship with Ross , so she writes an 18 page letter to get his thoughts on things .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The beach house, the next morning. Ross is passed out on the kitchen counter. He wakes up with a start and has one of the pages of the letter stuck to his face.]

utterances.transcript: Oh. Oh-oh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes reading the letter)

utterances.transcript: Hey! What happened to you? Why didn't you come up?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (coming down the stairs) Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts the letter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? Why didn't you come up?

utterances.transcript: Done!
You just finished?
Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!
So umm, does it?
I'm sorry.
Does it?
Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole 'Does it?' part just another glance.
What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice! Look, y'know what, either it does or it doesn't, and if you have to even think about it...
No, Rach, no. I don't, I don't, I don't have to think about it, in fact, I've decided, I've decided that, that it.......does.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (interrupting) No, Rach, no. I don't, I don't, I don't have to think about it, in fact, I've decided, I've decided that, that it.......does.
(Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugs him. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the 'Does it?' part in the letter.)

utterances.transcript: Are you sure?
Oh, sure! I'm sure.
I know.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know. (Hugs him more violently this time and pushes him back away from the letter.)

plots: Meanwhile , Rachel writes a long letter to Ross that Rachel needs Ross to read before they get back together ; Ross tries to read it but falls asleep ... then has to fake it when Rachel asks him about it ; Ross agrees with the letter before Ross finds out what it says ; once Ross finds out the letter asks Ross to accept the breakup was all Ross 's fault , Ross 's not sure Ross can keep up the charade .

When Ross returns to Rachel 's room and informs Rachel that Ross has ended Ross 's relationship with Bonnie and Bonnie has left , Ross is bemused to then learn that while Ross was doing this Rachel had written Ross a letter that is eighteen pages ( front and back ) long .

Understandably tired after breaking up with Bonnie , Ross falls asleep at the kitchen table reading the letter , and when he wakes up the next morning , he lies and claims that he has read the letter thoroughly when he has not finished it .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler about the letter.]

utterances.transcript: She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful to her! WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful to her! (Both Joey and Chandler shrug their shoulders as to say "Well...") (yelling) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!

utterances.transcript: Oh my God! If you say that one more time, I'm gonna break up with you!

Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says here, "If you accept full responsibility..." Full responsibility! "...I can begin to trust you again. Does that seem like something you can do. Does it?!!"
utterances.transcript_with_note: Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says here, (reading from the letter) "If you accept full responsibility..." (to Chandler and Joey) Full responsibility! "...I can begin to trust you again. Does that seem like something you can do. (yells at Joey) Does it?!!"

utterances.transcript: No?
Look, Ross, you have what you want, you're back with Rachel. If you bring this up now you're gonna wreck the best thing that even happened to you.
Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you're right. Yeah I guess I'll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (calming down) Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you're right. Yeah I guess I'll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.

utterances.transcript_with_note: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel, yeah! About jellyfish and how if you... (stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed on yourself?!

utterances.transcript: Ewwww!!
You can't say that!! You-you don't know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn't...bend that way. So...
utterances.transcript_with_note: You can't say that!! You-you don't know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn't...bend that way. So... (looks at Joey.)

utterances.transcript: Ewwww!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (turning to look at Joey) Ewwww!!

utterances.transcript: That's right I stepped up! She's my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I'd pee on anyone of you! Only, uhh, I couldn't. I got the stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to Chandler.
Joey kept screaming at me, "Do it now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!" Sometimes late at night I can still here the screaming.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (wails loudly into his hands) Joey kept screaming at me, "Do it now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!" Sometimes late at night I can still here the screaming.

utterances.transcript: That's 'cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to freak you out.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (laughs) That's 'cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to freak you out.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.]

utterances.transcript: "...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroommmm." Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom. Except for you. You go away.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (singing) "...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroommmm." (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you. You go away.

utterances.transcript: I'll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there hasn't been a day where I didn't regret giving you up.
Okay, bye.

No, I'm not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the reason I didn't look you up was, well I was afraid that you'd react, just well like, the way, the way you're reacting right now, and can't we just, y'know, start from here?
No.
Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family. I'm family, I'm it. Now, now I'm done.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family. I'm family, I'm it. Now, now I'm done. (starts to leave)

utterances.transcript: But, it's not like we're losing anything. Y'know?
Yeah, I guess you're right.
It's not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything in common.
Well, I don't know. I mean it's not like we don't have anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.
I-I like pizza!
You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.
Oh my God, so do I!
I knew it, wow!!
Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?
Ohh, so cute.
Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I'm-I'm mad at you.
I know. I'm mad at me too.
Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I'm kinda hungry.
Hey! Me too!
All right, stop it. Now you're just doing it to freak me out.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Rachel's bedroom. Ross and Rachel have just finished consummating the new relationship.]

utterances.transcript: Oh-hooo, I missed you.
I missed you too.
Ooh, I was soo nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much you've grown. Y'know?
I suppose.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (getting miffed) I suppose.

utterances.transcript: You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom never thought this would work out. It was all, "Once a cheater, always a cheater."
Umm-hmm.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (getting angry) Umm-hmm.

utterances.transcript: Ooh, I just wish we hadn't lost those four months, but if time was what you needed just to gain a little perspective...

utterances.transcript_with_note: [cut to Monica cleaning the floor in the kitchen]

utterances.transcript: WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (yelling from the bedroom) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!

utterances.transcript: Coffee house?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering with Joey) (to Monica) Coffee house?

utterances.transcript: You bet.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [cut back to Rachel's bedroom with both of them hurriedly getting dressed]

utterances.transcript: And for the record, it took two people to break up this relationship!!
Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!
I didn't know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn't finish the whole letter!
What?!!
I fell asleep!
You fell asleep?!
It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means 'you are,' Y-O-U-R means 'your!'
utterances.transcript_with_note: It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen) (to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means 'you are,' Y-O-U-R means 'your!'

utterances.transcript: Y'know I can't believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!
FINE BY ME!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)

utterances.transcript: Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy when you're at home on Saturday nights playing Scrabble with Monica!!
Hey!!
Sorry!! I just feel bad about all that sleep you're gonna miss wishing you were with me!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Monica) Sorry!! (to Ross) I just feel bad about all that sleep you're gonna miss wishing you were with me!

utterances.transcript: Oh, no-no-no don't you worry about me falling asleep. I still have your letter!!!
And hey! Just so you know, it's not that common! It doesn't happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!
I KNEW IT!!!!

utterances.transcript: Gin.
